prompt_sent_to_api:
You are a senior clinical geneticist. Your task is to synthesize findings from the provided analytical tool reports into a single, ranked list of potential diagnoses.

Create a master list of all unique disease candidates from all reports. Then, rank them from most to least plausible based on the strength of the evidence (consensus across tools, high scores/ranks).

Your final output must be a numbered list. Each line should contain only the rank, disease name, and OMIM ID. Do not include any reasoning or other text.

**Example Output:**
1. DISEASE NAME 1 (OMIM:XXXXXX)
2. DISEASE NAME 2 (OMIM:YYYYYY)
3. DISEASE NAME 3 (OMIM:ZZZZZZ)

---
INPUT CONTEXT

II. Analytical Tool Reports

PubCaseFinder Report (Phenotype-based):
- Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations (Score: 0.786)
- Larsen-like syndrome, B3GAT3 type (Score: 0.765)
- Shprintzen-Goldberg syndrome (Score: 0.764)
- Costello syndrome (Score: 0.759)
- autosomal recessive Robinow syndrome (Score: 0.754)

Zero-Shot Diagnosis Report (Generative AI-based):
- CLEIDOCRANIAL DYSPLASIA, RECESSIVE FORM (Rank: 1)
- SAETHRE-CHOTZEN SYNDROME; SCS (Rank: 2)
- CRANIOFRONTONASAL SYNDROME; CFNS (Rank: 3)
- KABUKI SYNDROME 2; KABUK2 (Rank: 4)

GestaltMatcher Report (Facial Dysmorphology-based):
- OHDO SYNDROME, SBBYS VARIANT; SBBYSS (Score: 0.533)
- CARDIAC, FACIAL, AND DIGITAL ANOMALIES WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DELAY; CAFDADD (Score: 0.481)
- FLOATING-HARBOR SYNDROME; FLHS (Score: 0.481)
- COSTELLO SYNDROME; CSTLO (Score: 0.461)
- GAND SYNDROME; GAND (Score: 0.460)

Phenotype Similarity Search Report (Vector-based):
- CRANIOLENTICULOSUTURAL DYSPLASIA (OMIM: 607812, Score: 0.867)
- OTOPALATODIGITAL SYNDROME, TYPE II (OMIM: 304120, Score: 0.863)
- SHORT-RIB THORACIC DYSPLASIA 16 WITH OR WITHOUT POLYDACTYLY (OMIM: 617102, Score: 0.862)
- THREE M SYNDROME 2 (OMIM: 612921, Score: 0.861)
- SPONDYLOEPIMETAPHYSEAL DYSPLASIA, FADEN-ALKURAYA TYPE (OMIM: 616723, Score: 0.861)

III. Supporting Literature
Web Search Results (Literature/Case Reports):
- Title: Au-Kline syndrome (Concept Id: C4225274) - MedGen - NCBI
